name: the horse riding person and the bear - chapter 2: imagination
description: “Give us the head! Give us the head! We will fish out your sorrow once we are done being fed!” But no promise of riches could strike at the core, of the horse riding person whose horse was no more. “The sun glaring high makes the head wet and swollen, tasty as fuck” says the fish with no luck. Dreaming of horses and bloody revenge the person takes no notice of current affairs. Yet when night falls on land, and sleep comes knocking, from droplets of water the dead rise flocking.
